manuscript.title: Müntehabü Ravzati'l-Ukûl ve'l-Efkâr ve Nüzheti'l-Esmâ' ve'l-Ebsâr
manuscript.format: risale within mecmûʿa (risale 1 of Esad Efendi 03413)

paper_decoration.summary: The YEK catalogue describes the paper as 'karisik renkte, ebrulu' (mixed-color, marbled), indicating marbled paper throughout this short risale. The marbled paper was not visually confirmed because the specific 6-folio risale could not be located within the 187-page host mecmûʿa; the designation rests on the explicit catalogue description by cataloguer Âzer Ateş. The manuscript also carries Arabic and Persian marginal glosses (hâşiye) on a significant number of leaves.

catalogue_description.paper_field: Aharli, dikey ve yatay suyolu, karisik renkte, ebrulu, filigranli, orta kalinlikta kagit
catalogue_description.notes_field: Kenarlari Arapca ve Farsca fevaidle oldukca hasiyealidir.

key_indicators: Ebrulu kâğıt noted in YEK kagit_ozellikleri field
Hareli (sized/burnished) paper with both chain and laid lines (dikey ve yatay suyolu)
Filigranli (watermarked) paper stock — possibly European import
cross_tradition_caveats: Manuscript is anonymous and undated; workshop assignment is entirely speculative
Mecmûʿa composite format means individual risales may originate from different production contexts
Mixed-colour ebru visible across Ottoman, Safavid, and Mughal traditions; Ottoman attribution relies solely on collection context

paper.description: Sized (âharlı), mixed-color, marbled (ebrulu), watermarked (filigranli), medium-weight paper. Both chain lines (dikey suyolu) and laid lines (yatay suyolu) noted, consistent with European or Europeanized paper stock.
paper.watermark: Filigran present; specific device not recorded in catalogue

binding.description: Brown leather over boards (mukavva üzerine kahve renkli deri kaplı), with gold chain-border (yaldız zencerekli), cedvelli, and headband (sirazeli). The binding covers the full mecmûʿa, not specifically this risale.

codicology.condition_summary: Condition not assessed; risale not located within digitized pages during visual confirmation.

limitations: Coverage: the target 6-folio risale was not located within the 187-page mecmûʿa during screenshot capture
Page 3 (p003) shows text from the larger mecmûʿa on standard cream paper — not the risale under study
Marbled paper identification rests entirely on the explicit YEK catalogue description (kagit_ozellikleri field); no visual verification achieved
Resolution of available IIIF images may be insufficient to distinguish marbled from plain paper at small thumbnail scale

bibliography.citation: Blair, Sheila S. 'Color and Gold: The Decorated Papers Used in Manuscripts in Later Islamic Times.' Muqarnas 17 (2000): 24–36.
bibliography.relevance: Foundational survey of decorated paper types in Islamic manuscripts, including marbled paper and its use in Ottoman and Persian production contexts.

bibliography.citation: Gacek, Adam. Arabic Manuscripts: A Vademecum for Readers. Leiden: Brill, 2009.
bibliography.relevance: Standard reference for codicological terminology including paper types, mecmûʿa structure, and marginal notation conventions.
bibliography.access_notes: Print; also available as e-book via Brill Online

bibliography.citation: Bloom, Jonathan M. Paper Before Print: The History and Impact of Paper in the Islamic World. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2001.
bibliography.relevance: Background on Islamic paper production, sizing, and trade networks relevant to understanding the mixed paper stock (âharlı, filigranli) described in this risale.

bibliography.citation: Déroche, François. Islamic Codicology: An Introduction to the Study of Manuscripts in Arabic Script. London: Al-Furqān Islamic Heritage Foundation, 2005.
bibliography.relevance: Codicological framework for describing mecmûʿa manuscripts, paper analysis, and marginal annotation practices in the Arabic and Ottoman traditions.

suggested_collections.reason: The full mecmûʿa (Esad Efendi 03413) is digitized; targeted folio navigation to locate the 6-folio risale is recommended before a higher-confidence classification can be assigned.

provenance.notes: Risale 1 of composite volume Esad Efendi 03413. Cataloguer: Âzer Ateş. YEK ID: 188283; IIIF ID: 0000000175217.

analysis_metadata.image_quality_notes: Only one screenshot captured (p003), showing text from the host mecmûʿa, not from the target risale. No folio-level analysis of marbled paper was possible.
folios_examined: p003 (mecmûʿa host — not the target risale)
analysis_metadata.folios_not_examined: All 6 folios of the target risale (specific location within 187-page mecmûʿa not identified). In-person examination at Süleymaniye Kütüphanesi or targeted IIIF folio navigation required.
